p: It was suggested that the antithrombotic effect of omega-3s can partially increase the bleeding risk, or even a sudden cardiac death. It was suggested, moreover, that fish oil therapy can cause a slightly higher risk of hemorrhagic stroke, but clinical evidence has not related an increased bleeding with omega-3 fatty acid consumption, even in combination with other agents that potentially increase bleeding (e.g., aspirin) [ 146]. This was confirmed in the study conducted by Watson et al. [ 147].
